name: txt_u
desc:
U: Controlled by you, the player!
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_utoo
desc:
player 2 has joined the game (dpad). Can also be spelled 'u2'.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_utres
desc:
and player 3 (ijkl or numpad).
If there are objects of two control schemes but not a third, the third control scheme can be used to move both of the first two at once.
Can also be spelled 'u3'.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_w
desc:
W: it's a double u (Alias: uu)
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_y'all
desc:
all players control y'all
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_you
desc:
YOU: Controlled by u, the player!
Can be controlled by all players.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_nogo
desc:
NO GO: Can't be entered by objects. Overrides GO AWAY PLS!
Anti: icyyyy

name: txt_gomyway
desc:
GO MY WAY: Prevents movement onto its tile from the tile in front of it and the two tiles 45 degrees to either side.
Anti: only enterable from directly behind

name: txt_goawaypls
desc:
GO AWAY PLS: Pushed by movement into its tile.
Anti: comepls

name: txt_comepls
desc:
COME PLS: Pulled by movement on adjacent tiles facing away from this unit.
Anti: goawaypls

name: txt_sidekik
desc:
SIDEKIK: If a unit moves perpendicularly away from a SIDEKIK, the SIDEKIK copies that movement.
Anti: goawaypls&comepls

name: txt_diagkik
desc:
DIAGKIK: If a unit moves 45 degrees away from a DIAGKIK, the DIAGKIK copies that movement. With two stacks, also copies 135 degree movement.
Anti: goawaypls&comepls&sidekik

name: txt_nedkee
desc:
NED KEE: When a NED KEE and FOR DOR unit move into each other or are on each other, they are both destroyed.
Anti: fordor

name: txt_fordor
desc:
FOR DOR: When a NED KEE and FOR DOR unit move into each other or are on each other, they are both destroyed.
Anti: nedkee

name: txt_:)
desc:
:): At end of turn, if U is on :) and survives, U R WIN!
Anti: un:)

name: txt_noswim
desc:
NO SWIM: At end of turn, if a NO SWIM unit is touching another object, all objects on the tile are destroyed.
Anti: giv protecc

name: txt_colrful
desc:
COLRFUL: Causes the unit to appear a variety of colours.
Anti: ??

name: txt_rave
desc:
RAVE: Causes the unit to flash through the rainbow extremely quickly.
Anti: ??

name: txt_tranz
desc:
TRANZ: Causes the unit to appear pink, white and baby blue. TRANZ objects are pinc, whit, and cyeann, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_gay
desc:
GAY: Causes the unit to appear rainbow coloured. GAY objects are reed, orang, yello, grun, bleu, and purp, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_enby
desc:
ENBY: Causes the unit to appear yellow, white, purple and black. ENBY objects are yello, whit, purp, and blacc, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_ace
desc:
ACE: Causes the unit to appear black, grey, white, and purple. ACE objects are blacc, graey, whit, and purp, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_pan
desc:
PAN: Causes the unit to appear pink, yellow, and cyan. PAN objects are pinc, yello, and cyeann, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_bi
desc:
BI: Causes the unit to appear pink, purple, and blue. BI objects are pinc, purp, and bleu, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_lesbab
desc:
LESBAB: Causes the unit to appear red, orange, white, and pink. LESBAB objects are reed, orang, whit, and pinc, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_aro
desc:
ARO: Causes the unit to appear green, white, grey, and black. ARO objects are grun, whit, graey, and blacc, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_fluid
desc:
FLUID: Causes the unit to appear pink, white, black, and blue. FLUID objects are pinc, whit, blacc, and bleu, and not any other colors.
Anti: poof

name: txt_slep
desc:
SLEP: SLEP units can't move due to being U, WALK, COPKAT or SPOOPed.
Anti: vibrate (like temmi)

name: txt_:(
desc:
:(: At end of turn, destroys any U objects on it.
Anti: destroy self

name: txt_walk
desc:
WALK: Moves in a straight line each turn, bouncing off walls.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_:o
desc:
:o: If U is on :o, the :o is collected. Bonus!
Anti: collect u (still gives bonus)

name: txt_direction
desc:
GO ->: The unit is forced to face the indicated direction. LOOKAT GO -> makes a unit look in that direction or is true if it is facing that direction. BEN'T GO -> prevents an object from facing that direction.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_up
desc:
UP: A GO ->, but facing up.
Anti: down

name: txt_left
desc:
LEFT: A GO ->, but facing left.
Anti: right

name: txt_down
desc:
DOWN: A GO ->, but facing down.
Anti: up

name: txt_right
desc:
RIGHT: A GO ->, but facing right.
Anti: left

name: txt_upleft
desc:
UPLEFT: A GO ->, but facing upleft. Can also be spelled leftup.
Anti: downright

name: txt_upright
desc:
UPRIGHT: A GO ->, but facing upright. Can also be spelled rightup.
Anti: downleft

name: txt_downleft
desc:
DOWNLEFT: A GO ->, but facing downleft. Can also be spelled leftdown.
Anti: upright

name: txt_downright
desc:
DOWNRIGHT: A GO ->, but facing downright. Can also be spelled rightdown.
Anti: upleft

name: txt_behinu
desc:
BEHIN U: BEHIN U units swap with everything on tiles they move into, and swap with units that move onto their tile, then face their swapee. Nothing personnel, kid.
Anti: goawaypls + can push everything

name: txt_ouch
desc:
OUCH: This unit is destroyed if it shares a tile with another object, or if it tries to move/be moved into and can't.
Anti: treats everything else as ouch

name: txt_qt
desc:
QT: Makes the unit emit love hearts.
Anti: is rong

name: txt_go
desc:
GO: This unit will force all other objects in its tile to move in its facing direction.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_goooo
desc:
GOOOO: The instant an object steps on a GOOOO unit, it is forced to move in the GOOOO unit's direction.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_icy
desc:
ICY: Objects on something ICY are forced to move in the direction they entered the ice (disabling everything SLEP does) until they either leave the ice or can't move any further.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_icyyyy
desc:
ICYYYY: The instant an object steps on an ICYYYY unit, it is forced to move again.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_delet
desc:
DELET: At end of turn, if U is on DELET, you get booted out of the level and erases all progress in the level (win, bonus, transformation).
Anti: win, bonus, and transform into the object stepped on

name: txt_diag
desc:
DIAG: Prevents the unit from moving orthogonally, unless it is also ORTHO. Also affects rule parsing.
Anti: ortho

name: txt_ortho
desc:
ORTHO: Prevents the unit from moving diagonally, unless it is also DIAG. Also affects rule parsing.
Anti: diag

name: txt_hotte
desc:
HOTTE: At end of turn, HOTTE units destroys all units that are FRIDGD on their tile.
Anti: fridgd

name: txt_fridgd
desc:
FRIDGD: At end of turn, HOTTE units destroys all units that are FRIDGD on their tile.
Anti: hotte

name: txt_protecc
desc:
PROTECC: Cannot be destroyed (but can be converted).
Anti: destroys object

name: txt_flye
desc:
FLYE: A FLYE unit doesn't interact with other objects on its tile, and can ignore the collision of other objects, unless that other object has the same amount of FLYE as the unit. FLYE stacks with itself! Also pushing can occur regardless of flye.
Adds 5 to draw layer per flye, and 15 if there's at least 1.
Anti: -1 to count

name: txt_tall
desc:
TALL: Considered to be every non-negative FLYE amount at once.
Anti: non-positive (stacks with non-anti to block all)

name: txt_haetskye
desc:
HAET SKYE: After movement, this unit falls DOWN as far as it can.
Anti: haetflor

name: txt_haetflor
desc:
HAET FLOR: After movement, this unit falls UP as far as it can.
Anti: haetskye

name: txt_moar
desc:
MOAR: At end of turn, this unit replicates to all free tiles that are adjacent.
It can spread to spaces in anywhere it can reach ignoring space shenanigans or blockages where ortho movement takes 2 points and diagonal 3, with (stacks+1) points; but only if those points either don't have anything blocking the object from entering (this can go through walls) or one of the object in question (which also won't grow two into the same space).
Anti: -1 stack; at negative, if it would grow to any space at |n| stacks, the object is deleted

name: txt_visitfren
desc:
VISIT FREN: At end of turn, all other objects are sent to the next VISIT FREN unit with the same name in reading order (left to right, line by line, wrapping around). Higher levels of VISIT FREN will cause the target to be 1 backward, 2 forward, 2 backward, etc.
Anti: visitfren object teleports to the next spot in level every turn

name: txt_stelth
desc:
STELTH: A STELTHy unit doesn't draw. STELTHy text won't appear in the rules list... kinda
Anti: adds 130 to object draw layer

name: txt_shy...
desc:
SHY...: Can't initiate or continue a goawaypls, comepls, sidekik, or diagkik movement, and can look away from those objects, sometimes.
Anti: stubbn

name: txt_folowal
desc:
FOLO WAL: At end of turn, faces the first direction that it could enter and that doesn't have another unit of its name: right, forward, left, backward. When combined with WALK, causes the unit to follow the right wall.
Anti: turn cornr

name: txt_turncornr
desc:
TURN CORNR: At end of turn, faces the first direction that it could enter and that doesn't have another unit of its name: forward, right, left, backward. When combined with WALK, causes the unit to bounce off walls at 90 degree angles.
Anti: folo wal

name: txt_nxt
desc:
nxt: If U is on nxt, go to the next level (specified in object settings).
Anti: auto return to map

name: txt_tryagain
desc:
TRY AGAIN: When U is on TRY AGAIN, the level is undone back to the starting state, except for NO UNDO objects. TRY AGAIN can be undone!
Anti: plays through the level's replay to the end

name: txt_noundo
desc:
NO UNDO: NO UNDO units aren't affected by undoing manually. LVL BE NO UNDO prevents undo inputs entirely.
Anti: undo

name: txt_undo
desc:
UNDO: UNDO units, at end of turn, rewind a turn earlier, cumulatively. Stacks!
Anti: no undo

name: txt_stubbn
desc:
STUBBN: STUBBN units ignore the special properties of WALK movers (bouncing off of walls, and declining to move if it would die due to being OUCH) and also makes attempted diagonal movement slide along walls. Stacks with itself - the more STUBBN, the more additional angles it will try, up to 180 degrees at 5 stacks! (2 stacks allows for 45 degree movement orthogonally.)
Anti: shy...

name: txt_goarnd
desc:
GO ARND: GO ARND units wrap around the level, as though it were a torus. BORDR objects are used as the level border, and the wraparound doesn't go through BORDRs. Diagonal GO ARNDs on corners of non-square levels might not work as expected, as it simply traces backward until hitting a BORDR.
Anti: flip around at edge (portal leading out to itself)

name: txt_mirrarnd
desc:
MIRR ARND: MIRR ARND units wrap around the level, as though it were a projective plane.
Anti: flip around + mirror at edge

name: txt_poortoll
desc:
POOR TOLL: If a unit would enter a POOR TOLL unit, it instead leaves the next POOR TOLL unit of the same name in reading order (left to right, line by line, wrapping around) out the corresponding same side. Does not stack.
Anti: to explain this to you, we have to talk about parallel universes. Also it's not made yet so i'll write about the skuttlebug jamborees when it is.

name: txt_split
desc:
SPLIT: Objects on a SPLITer are split into two copies on adjacent tiles.
Anti: pulls objects arond to become 1

name: txt_munwalk
desc:
MUNWALK: MUNWALK units move 180 degrees opposite of their facing direction. Stacks will cancel each other out.
Anti: literally nothing

name: txt_sidestep
desc:
SIDESTEP: SIDESTEP units move 90 degrees clockwise off of their facing direction. Stacks!
Anti: stack 3

name: txt_diagstep
desc:
DIAGSTEP: DIAGSTEP units move 45 degrees clockwise off of their facing direction. Stacks!
Anti: stack 7

name: txt_knightstep
desc:
KNIGHTSTEP: KNIGHTSTEP units move like the Knight chess piece, rotated 22.5 degrees clockwise. Stacks add additional 1, 1 hops.
Anti: move like a pawn (todo: make better desc after implemented)

name: txt_hopovr
desc:
HOPOVR: HOPOVR units move two tiles ahead, skipping the intermediate tile. Stacks!
Anti: i cant visualize this one

name: txt_spin
desc:
SPIN: A GO^ facing the same direction as the unit is facing, rotated clockwise the number of times on top of the property.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_brite
desc:
BRITE: Emits light in all directions.
Anti: tranparnt

name: txt_tranparnt
desc:
TRANPARN'T: Blocks light using a non-tile based system. Also blocks meow.
Anti: brite

name: txt_torc
desc:
TORC: A TORC object emits light in the direction they're facing. The angle of the light determined by the number of TORC stacks. (WIP)
Anti: gomyway but for light (WIP)

name: txt_noturn
desc:
NO TURN: A NO TURN unit's direction can't change (unless re-oriented by non-euclidean level geometry, i.e. POOR TOLL).
Anti: rotatbl

name: txt_wurd
desc:
WURD: A WURD unit forms rules as though it was its respective text. TXT BEN'T WURD makes that text not parse.
Anti: parse in opposite direction (stacks with normal wurd)

name: txt_zawarudo
desc:
ZA WARUDO: Can stop time and move without anything else moving. Faster than rule parsing itself!
After forming the rule, press E (hourglass on mobile) to toggle. While stopped, a non-zawarudo object that would move at infinite speed will move one space per turn.
Anti: is frozen outside timestop but not inside

name: txt_txtify
desc:
TXTIFY: BE TXTIFY causes that object to be turned into its corresponding metatext.
Anti: thingify

name: txt_thingify
desc:
THINGIFY: BE THINGIFY causes that text to turn into the object it represents (or text it represents if metatext).
Some objects are special and can only be gotten via thingify.
Anti: txtify

name: txt_curse
desc:
CURSE: Makes object move like U on lins/lvls and able to enter lvls (also goes through walls)
Also adds 24 to draw layer.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_her
desc:
HER ->: Sends objects to where the text indicates. N'T HER makes objects HAET that tile.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_thr
desc:
THR ->: Sends objects as far away from it as possible (until hitting a wall) in the indicated direction. N'T THR makes objects HAET a line from the text.
Anti: opposite direction

name: txt_rithere
desc:
RIT HERE: Sends objects to where the text is.
Anti: random space in lvl other than this one

name: txt_stayther
desc:
STAY THER: Objects with this property will be taken with you when you transition between levels.
Anti: object vanishes

name: txt_glued
desc:
GLUED: Stuck to adjacent units with glued, and can't move unless the entire block can simultaneously move.
Can also form same[paint/flye/face] to make something only glued to those items.
Anti: ignores comepls/sidekik/diagkik

name: txt_rotatbl
desc:
ROTATBL: Makes any object able to be rotated.
Anti: noturn

name: txt_nuek
desc:
NUEK: A NUEK will begin destroying everything around it, its radius growing once per turn.
Anti: places xplod at the corners of lvl

name: txt_un:)
desc:
UN:): When U touches UN:), the current level will no longer be considered won, without exiting the level. Imagine a win score equal to the number of Us on :) minus the Us on UN:). If positive, you win. If negative, you lose your win. If equal, nothing happens.
Anti: :)

name: txt_notranform
desc:
NO TRANFORM: A property that prevents the object from transforming. LVL BE NO TRANFORM reverts any transformations it had. X BEN'T NOTRANFORM negates X BE X. Also negates TRANZ.
Anti: tranz

name: txt_reflecc
desc:
REFLECC: When a unit moves into a REFLECC's front or behind, it gets reflected off of that surface.
Anti: ??

name: txt_stukc
desc:
STUKC: Anything with this property can't move.
Anti: if not moved this turn, move in a random direction

name: txt_gone
desc:
GONE: If something is GONE, it floats away into nothingness.
Anti: restore all objects of type that have died (todo: define died)

name: txt_dragbl
desc:
DRAGBL: Units that are DRAGBL can be picked up and moved around.
Anti: takes the opposite of your mouse movements

name: txt_nodrag
desc:
NO DRAG: Units that are DRAGBL can't be placed on NO DRAG objects.
Anti: mous cant move on or over

name: txt_thicc
desc:
THICC: Thicc things take up a 2x2 space. Expands to the lower right.
Anti: babby (yes, the noun)

name: txt_rythm
desc:
RYTHM (property): Turns pass for these units based on time, separate from normal turns passing. Uses the same system as zawarudo.
Anti: follows random intervals instead of a rhythm

name: txt_cool
desc:
COOL: COOL units wear a pair of sunglasses, and don't shake.
Anti: hotte

name: txt_thonk
desc:
THONK: THONK units question their own FRAGIL existence.
Anti: ??

name: txt_sublvl
desc: SUBLVL: An object that is sublvl will become enterable. Currently unimplemented, and likely won't ever be.

name: txt_b)
desc: B): At end of turn, if U is on B) and survives, U R COOL! (This currently does nothing.)

name: txt_cilindr
desc: CILINDR: CILINDR units wrap around the level, as though it were a cylinder with the indicated orientation.

name: txt_mobyus
desc: MOBYUS: MOBYUS units wrap around the level, as though it were a mobius strip with the indicated orientation.
